channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Black Basta Ransomware Leader Added to EU Most Wanted and INTERPOL Red Notice
item.description: Ukrainian and German law enforcement authorities have identified two Ukrainians suspected of working for the Russia-linked ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group Black Basta. In addition, the group's alleged leader, a 35-year-old Russian national named Oleg Evgenievich Nefedov (Нефедов Олег...

item.title: Tennessee Man Pleads Guilty to Repeatedly Hacking Supreme Court’s Filing System
item.description: Nicholas Moore pleaded guilty to repeatedly hacking the U.S. Supreme Court’s filing system and illegally accessing computer systems belonging to AmeriCorps and the Department of Veterans Affairs. The post Tennessee Man Pleads Guilty to Repeatedly Hacking Supreme Court’s Filing System appeared first...

item.title: OpenAI to Show Ads in ChatGPT for Logged-In U.S. Adults on Free and Go Plans
item.description: OpenAI on Friday said it would start showing ads in ChatGPT to logged-in adult U.S. users in both the free and ChatGPT Go tiers in the coming weeks, as the artificial intelligence (AI) company expanded access to its low-cost subscription globally. "You need to know that your data and conversations...

item.title: Brex’s AI Hail Mary — With CTO James Reggio
item.description: Inside Brex’s $500M+ (ARR) AI-Fueled Comeback

item.title: Disruption with some GitHub services
item.description: Jan 17, 01:28 UTCUpdate - Deployment of the fix is in progress. We are still targetting 2:00 AM UTC for full resolution.Jan 17, 00:08 UTCUpdate - Some enterprise Copilot CLI users may encounter an "You are not authorized to use this Copilot feature" error. item.title: GootLoader Malware Uses 500–1,000 Concatenated ZIP Archives to Evade Detection
item.description: The JavaScript (aka JScript) malware loader called GootLoader has been observed using a malformed ZIP archive that's designed to sidestep detection efforts by concatenating anywhere from 500 to 1,000 archives. "The actor creates a malformed archive as an anti-analysis technique," Expel security...

item.title: In Other News: FortiSIEM Flaw Exploited, Sean Plankey Renominated, Russia’s Polish Grid Attack
item.description: Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: BodySnatcher agentic AI hijacking, Telegram IP exposure, shipping systems hacked by researcher. The post In Other News: FortiSIEM Flaw Exploited, Sean Plankey Renominated, Russia’s Polish Grid Attack appeared first on...

item.title: Monnai Raises $12 Million for Identity and Risk Data Infrastructure
item.description: The company will use the investment to accelerate the adoption of its solution among financial institutions and digital businesses. The post Monnai Raises $12 Million for Identity and Risk Data Infrastructure appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Project Eleven Raises $20 Million for Post-Quantum Security
item.description: The startup is building the necessary infrastructure and tools to help organizations transition to post-quantum computing. The post Project Eleven Raises $20 Million for Post-Quantum Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Five Malicious Chrome Extensions Impersonate Workday and NetSuite to Hijack Accounts
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered five new malicious Google Chrome web browser extensions that masquerade as human resources (HR) and enterprise resource planning (ERP) platforms like Workday, NetSuite, and SuccessFactors to take control of victim accounts. "The extensions work in concert...

item.title: The Download: cut through AI coding hype, and biotech trends to watch
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. AI coding is now everywhere. But not everyone is convinced. Depending who you ask, AI-powered coding is either giving software developers...

item.title: 750,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Canadian Investment Watchdog
item.description: The incident impacted the personal information of CIRO member firms and their registered employees. The post 750,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Canadian Investment Watchdog appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Issue with Ruleset Modification Audit Logs
item.description: Jan 16, 10:42 UTCInvestigating - Cloudflare is investigating an issue where some audit logs for ruleset modifications are not appearing in the Dashboard. We are working to resolve the issue. More updates to follow shortly.

item.title: Your Digital Footprint Can Lead Right to Your Front Door
item.description: You lock your doors at night. You avoid sketchy phone calls. You’re careful about what you post on social media. But what about the information about you that’s already out there—without your permission? Your name. Home address. Phone number. Past jobs. Family members. Old usernames. It’s all still...

item.title: Three technologies that will shape biotech in 2026
item.description: Earlier this week, MIT Technology Review published its annual list of Ten Breakthrough Technologies. As always, it features technologies that made the news last year, and which—for better or worse—stand to make waves in the coming years. They’re the technologies you should really be paying...

item.title: Li Auto i8 Debuts In-House High-Voltage SiC E-Drive, Named One of China’s Top 10 New Energy Powertrains of the Year
item.description: Li Auto has earned top industry recognition with its fully self-developed high-voltage SiC electric drive system, marking a major milestone in its core powertrain technology.

item.title: Meituan Releases LongCat-Flash-Thinking-2601, Setting a New Benchmark for Open-Source Tool-Calling AI
item.description: Meituan has unveiled a new open-source AI model that pushes agentic reasoning and tool invocation to the forefront of the global open-source ecosystem.

item.title: Chery’s 2026 “AI Night” to Showcase Super AI Agents, Ultra-Fast Charging, and Next-Gen Smart Mobility
item.description: Chery Automobile is set to unveil its latest AI-driven mobility vision with a major technology showcase highlighting intelligent agents, smart driving, and next-generation energy solutions.

item.title: NIO Forms an “AI Dream Team” as CEO William Li Establishes AI Committee to Drive Company-Wide Transformation
item.description: NIO is doubling down on artificial intelligence as a core engine of its turnaround strategy by launching a top-level AI governance body to embed AI across its entire business.

item.title: China’s FAST Radio Telescope to Be Upgraded into a “Cosmic Super Probe” with Dozens of New Antennas
item.description: China is planning a major upgrade to its flagship FAST radio telescope, aiming to transform it into a far more powerful instrument for probing the deepest mysteries of the universe.

item.title: AI Survival Stories: a Taxonomic Analysis of AI Existential Risk
item.description: arXiv:2601.09765v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Since the release of ChatGPT, there has been a lot of debate about whether AI systems pose an existential risk to humanity. This paper develops a general framework for thinking about the existential risk of AI systems. We analyze a two premise...

item.title: GUI-Eyes: Tool-Augmented Perception for Visual Grounding in GUI Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.09770v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in vision-language models (VLMs) and reinforcement learning (RL) have driven progress in GUI automation. However, most existing methods rely on static, one-shot visual inputs and passive perception, lacking the ability to adaptively...

item.title: PCN-Rec: Agentic Proof-Carrying Negotiation for Reliable Governance-Constrained Recommendation
item.description: arXiv:2601.09771v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modern LLM-based recommenders can generate compelling ranked lists, but they struggle to reliably satisfy governance constraints such as minimum long-tail exposure or diversity requirements. We present PCN-Rec, a proof-carrying negotiation pipeline...

item.title: Antisocial behavior towards large language model users: experimental evidence
item.description: arXiv:2601.09772v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid spread of large language models (LLMs) has raised concerns about the social reactions they provoke. Prior research documents negative attitudes toward AI users, but it remains unclear whether such disapproval translates into costly action....

item.title: Improving Chain-of-Thought for Logical Reasoning via Attention-Aware Intervention
item.description: arXiv:2601.09805v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modern logical reasoning with LLMs primarily relies on employing complex interactive frameworks that decompose the reasoning process into subtasks solved through carefully designed prompts or requiring external resources (e.g., symbolic solvers) to...

item.title: Social Determinants of Health Prediction for ICD-9 Code with Reasoning Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.09709v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Social Determinants of Health correlate with patient outcomes but are rarely captured in structured data. Recent attention has been given to automatically extracting these markers from clinical text to supplement diagnostic systems with knowledge of...

item.title: The Geometry of Thought: Disclosing the Transformer as a Tropical Polynomial Circuit
item.description: arXiv:2601.09775v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that the Transformer self-attention mechanism in the high-confidence regime ($\beta \to \infty$, where $\beta$ is an inverse temperature) operates in the tropical semiring (max-plus algebra). In particular, we show that taking the tropical...

item.title: TimeSAE: Sparse Decoding for Faithful Explanations of Black-Box Time Series Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.09776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As black box models and pretrained models gain traction in time series applications, understanding and explaining their predictions becomes increasingly vital, especially in high-stakes domains where interpretability and trust are essential. However,...

item.title: QFed: Parameter-Compact Quantum-Classical Federated Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.09809v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Organizations and enterprises across domains such as healthcare, finance, and scientific research are increasingly required to extract collective intelligence from distributed, siloed datasets while adhering to strict privacy, regulatory, and...

item.title: Eluder dimension: localise it!
item.description: arXiv:2601.09825v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We establish a lower bound on the eluder dimension of generalised linear model classes, showing that standard eluder dimension-based analysis cannot lead to first-order regret bounds. To address this, we introduce a localisation method for the eluder...

item.title: LLM-Driven Preference Data Synthesis for Proactive Prediction of the Next User Utterance in Human-Machine Dialogue
item.description: arXiv:2601.09713v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Proactively predicting a users next utterance in human-machine dialogue can streamline interaction and improve user experience. Existing commercial API-based solutions are subject to privacy concerns while deploying general-purpose LLMs locally...

item.title: Evaluating Novelty in AI-Generated Research Plans Using Multi-Workflow LLM Pipelines
item.description: arXiv:2601.09714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The integration of Large Language Models (LLMs) into the scientific ecosystem raises fundamental questions about the creativity and originality of AI-generated research. Recent work has identified ``smart plagiarism'' as a concern in single-step...

item.title: Introducing Axlerod: An LLM-based Chatbot for Assisting Independent Insurance Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.09715v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The insurance industry is undergoing a paradigm shift through the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies, particularly in the realm of intelligent conversational agents. Chatbots have evolved into sophisticated AI-driven systems capable...

item.title: Opportunities and Challenges of Natural Language Processing for Low-Resource Senegalese Languages in Social Science Research
item.description: arXiv:2601.09716v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is rapidly transforming research methodologies across disciplines, yet African languages remain largely underrepresented in this technological shift. This paper provides the first comprehensive overview of NLP...

item.title: SALP-CG: Standard-Aligned LLM Pipeline for Classifying and Grading Large Volumes of Online Conversational Health Data
item.description: arXiv:2601.09717v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Online medical consultations generate large volumes of conversational health data that often embed protected health information, requiring robust methods to classify data categories and assign risk levels in line with policies and practice. However,...

item.title: WildRayZer: Self-supervised Large View Synthesis in Dynamic Environments
item.description: We present WildRayZer, a self-supervised framework for novel view synthesis (NVS) in dynamic environments where both the camera and objects move. Dynamic content breaks the multi-view consistency that static NVS models rely on, leading to ghosting, hallucinated geometry, and unstable pose...

item.title: Alterbute: Editing Intrinsic Attributes of Objects in Images
item.description: We introduce Alterbute, a diffusion-based method for editing an object's intrinsic attributes in an image. We allow changing color, texture, material, and even the shape of an object, while preserving its perceived identity and scene context. Existing approaches either rely on unsupervised priors...

item.title: MatchTIR: Fine-Grained Supervision for Tool-Integrated Reasoning via Bipartite Matching
item.description: Tool-Integrated Reasoning (TIR) empowers large language models (LLMs) to tackle complex tasks by interleaving reasoning steps with external tool interactions. However, existing reinforcement learning methods typically rely on outcome- or trajectory-level rewards, assigning uniform advantages to all...

item.title: PACEvolve: Enabling Long-Horizon Progress-Aware Consistent Evolution
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as powerful operators for evolutionary search, yet the design of efficient search scaffolds remains ad hoc. While promising, current LLM-in-the-loop systems lack a systematic approach to managing the evolutionary process. We identify three distinct failure...

item.title: The Download: spying on the spies, and promising climate tech

item.title: Molmo2: Open Weights and Data for Vision-Language Models with Video Understanding and Grounding
item.description: Today's strongest video-language models (VLMs) remain proprietary. The strongest open-weight models either rely on synthetic data from proprietary VLMs, effectively distilling from them, or do not disclose their training data or recipe. As a result, the open-source community lacks the foundations...
